title: golem-powers:context7 - Replace Context7 MCP with executable skill
description: Convert Context7 from MCP to golem-powers skill. Context7 provides library documentation lookup. The skill wraps their API/CLI in executable scripts, outputting Markdown. This eliminates MCP server overhead while keeping functionality.

acceptanceCriteria.text: Research: Check if Context7 has a CLI or only HTTP API
Create directory: skills/golem-powers/context7/
Create SKILL.md with frontmatter: name: context7, description: Library documentation lookup, execute: scripts/query.sh
Create scripts/resolve-library.sh:
- Takes library name as argument: ./resolve-library.sh react
- Calls Context7 API to resolve library ID
- Outputs Markdown: library name, ID, description
- chmod +x the script
Create scripts/query-docs.sh:
- Takes library ID and query as arguments: ./query-docs.sh /vercel/next.js 'how to use app router'
- Calls Context7 API to get documentation
- Outputs Markdown: formatted documentation excerpts
- chmod +x the script
Create scripts/default.sh that shows usage help
Handle API authentication: check for CONTEXT7_API_KEY env var or use public API
Create workflows/lookup.md - step-by-step for looking up library docs
Document in SKILL.md how to disable Context7 MCP after skill works
Symlink to ~/.claude/commands/golem-powers/context7
Run shellcheck on all .sh files - must pass
Test: Query React docs via skill, verify Markdown output
Test: Query Next.js app router docs, verify useful response
